intro: Oldenlandia tenuis, commonly known as slenderleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual or perennial, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its small, white or pale blue flowers are borne in clusters and are accompanied by narrow, grass-like leaves. The species is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
